Morphemic: tā shi yi-ge hěn hǎo de rén
Gloss: 3SG be one-CL  very good de person

Translation: Intended: ‘S/he is a very good person.’
Comment: Huang (2006) states that complex adjectives can not occur alone in the modifier position. A intervening de is required.

Translation: ‘S/He is fat (and Zhāngsān is not fat).’
Comment: Li & Thompson (1981) allows the use of adjectives such as pàng alone, while Huang (2006) claims that they can't stand alone in a predicate position, a degree modifier such as hěn is required.

Translation: ‘There came a person who is (very) hard-working.’
Comment: Huang (2006) also claims that hěn is required here.

Morphemic: tā yǒu yi-ge mèimei, hěn xǐhuān kàn diànyǐng
Gloss: 3SG exist one-CL younger-sister very like see movie
Translation: ‘S/He has a younger sister who likes to see movies.’
Comment: Li & Thompson (1981) defines such constructions as descriptive clausese. It involves a transitive verb who direct object is described by a following clause.

Morphemic: tā yǒu yi-ge hěn xǐhuān kàn diànyǐng mèimei
Gloss: 3SG exist one-CL very like see movie de younger-sister
Translation: ‘S/He has a younger sister who likes to see movies.’
